answers.author: Michael Morrison
answers.text:
Check with the City of Abilene, Texas.  The Cultural Affairs Council of the Chamber of Commerce has an excellent arts program funded through a public/private partnership.


Check with the City of Abilene, Texas.  The Cultural Affairs Council of the Chamber of Commerce has an excellent arts program funded through a public/private partnership.

answers.author: Leslie Beauregard
answers.text:
The City of Charlottesville Parks and Recreation departmetn contracts with a non profit that provides public art around the City.  Here's their website:  http://www.artinplace.org/

author: Pamela Muse
text:
An Alliance member is asking "If a city does not have a parks dept, do they have an arts commission? "
Are there successful models out there to give the residents an “arts outlet” that does not involve creating a bureaucratic, static citizens’ commission, etc?
Your expertise is appreciated!
Pamela Muse
Western Regional Director
Alliance for Innovation
888-468-6450 Voice
480-231-3538 Text
pmuse@transformgov.org
title: Art in Public Places Programs
